intro: Notholaena sciadioides, commonly known as the false nettle, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Urticaceae. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves with serrated margins. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in dense clusters, which are often subtended by bracts. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Notholaena sciadioides is noted for its hairy foliage and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
